# DispatchTimeInterval

**Enumeration**

A number of seconds, millisconds, microseconds, or nanoseconds.

## Declaration

```swift
enum DispatchTimeInterval
```

## Overview

Use [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/DispatchTimeInterval] values to specify the interval at which a [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/DispatchSourceTimer] fires or I/O handlers are invoked for a [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/DispatchIO] channel, as well as to increment and decrement [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/DispatchTime] values.

## Enumeration Cases

- **DispatchTimeInterval.seconds(_:)**: A number of seconds.
- **DispatchTimeInterval.milliseconds(_:)**: A number of milliseconds.
- **DispatchTimeInterval.microseconds(_:)**: A number of microseconds.
- **DispatchTimeInterval.nanoseconds(_:)**: A number of nanoseconds.
- **DispatchTimeInterval.never**: No interval.

## Time Constructs

- **DispatchTime**: A point in time relative to the default clock, with nanosecond precision.
- **DispatchWallTime**: An absolute point in time according to the wall clock, with microsecond precision.
- **DispatchTimeoutResult**: A result value indicating whether a dispatch operation finished before a specified time.
- **dispatch_time_t**: An abstract representation of time.
- **DISPATCH_WALLTIME_NOW**: The current time.
- **Wall Time Constants**: Constants for wall time values.

## Conforms To

- Equatable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
